webResources.textAttributionSnippet: (en) Portrait of the regimental physician and writer Carl Anton Wetterbergh, best known by the pseudonym Onkel Adam. From 1847 in service as a regimental physician at the First Life-Grenadar Regiment in Lköpping but not permanent residence in the city until 1867. Parallel to the medical profession, he was a recognised author of novels and short stories.  At the beginning of the 1860s, he lost the desire to write that kind of literature. Instead, from 1862 he was devoted to publishing the children’s newspaper Linnea. His home in Lköpping, Onkel Adamsgården, is preserved and the upper floor of the house serves since 1927 as a museum to his remembrance - https://www.europeana.eu/item/73/S_OM_photo_OMEA0001240110. (en) Bergh, Peter Johansson. Östergötlands museum - http://digitaltmuseum.se/021017436780. Public Domain Mark - http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/

concept_note: Person who uses written words to communicate ideas and to produce works of literature
